thread.title: Mother Mary Statue In Mumbai Was Vandalised By Youth Looking For Money To Bail Out His Father - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: Mother Mary Statue In Mumbai Was Vandalised By Youth Looking For Money To Bail Out His Father - Indiatimes.com

title: Mother Mary Statue In Mumbai Was Vandalised By Youth Looking For Money To Bail Out His Father - Indiatimes.com
text:
Bobins Abraham February 22, 2017 
Police in Kurla, Mumbai has arrested two youths in connection with the desecration of a Mother Mary statue on Sunday. 
The duo has been identified as Kiran Shyam Rode, and Babu Kunchikurve, both residents of Makadwala compound in Kurla. 
They were nabbed with the help of CCTV visuals from the crime scene. Though they were wearing helmets, police were able to identify the number of their bike, leading the cops to the culprits. 
According to police, Kiran planned the thing with the help of his friend Babu to find money to bail out his father who was arrested in a theft case. 
They broke the glass of the grotto of Virgin Mary, hoping to find some gold there, deputy commissioner of police Paramjeet Dahiya said. 
"Somebody told him that Mother Mary statue had a real gold chain on it and hence they decided to steal the chain and sell off to get his father bailed out." 
The incident, which happened in a Christian neighbourhood had triggered mass protest on Sunday demanding the arrest of the culprits. Don't Miss
